turns.text: And I know that one of them fucked like two other girls, who were both virgins, so I knew he was safe.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: And the other person I just fucked, which was a mistake. But I went to the clinic last week with Jennie.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: I made her get tested with me because I didn't want to go alone.

turns.speaker: LINDA
turns.text: Did they ask you a lot of questions?

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: How can you hang out with Casper? He's such a jerk.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: Yeah. I've always hated that kid. He used to eat glue in like seventh grade.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: He still does.

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: I hate 'em.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: It's not his fault. He had a hard life.

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: You've heard the stories right?

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: So that's why Casper is how he is.

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: Oh god. That's horrible.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: Holy shit. That's all true?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: No. I was just kidding.

turns.speaker: MISHA
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I lied. His dad is still alive. He works for the post office.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Hi mom.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Hi Telly. Where you been?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Sorry. Dad made me promise not to give you any money until you find a job.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: But then I won't need your money.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Mom.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Shh.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: I'm gonna go out for a little while.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: When are you gonna be back?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Not too late.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Four-thirty in the morning?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Not too late.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Hey Mom. Are you sure I can't get any money? Just a few bucks.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: If I had it, maybe. But right now I don't have a penny to my name.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: It's me. Telly.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Paul it's Telly. Open up.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What are you guys doing?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Nothing. We just wanted to come by and see what you were up to.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You want a wip-it?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: So, how many people live here now?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't know, eight or nine.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Where does everyone sleep?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Everywhere. Fuckin' flophouse. We're still short on the rent. If you want, you and Casper can move in. You guys can share the bathtub.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That's the whole thing. You know if you look at it. I mean all you hear about is disease this and disease that. And everyone's dying. And you better wear a condom or else. But the truth is. I don't know any kids with AIDS. No one I know has ever died from that shit. It's like some weird make-believe story that the whole world believes.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: First times are always wacked. Just be glad you didn't lose your virginity in the backseat of a rental car.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: That shit is nothin'. I remember, I had just turned 14. With this fuckin' asshole who was like 18. I don't even remember his name. I think it was John or Jake or something. I remember he had a brother named Lentil because I would always joke and call him Lentil Bean. This was away at like sleep away camp with your friends and shit.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Slow.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: It's grandmother style.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: It's very monotonous.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: And we were like underneath the sheets. We were going at it like crazy. Oh my God that shit was so good! It was like hard...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: He was like sucking my tits. He was fucking fingering me. But that shit was nice and hard.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yeah. And it takes them either too long or too short to come. Have you ever had someone that took forever

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: To come?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yeah. I had sex with Jake, and it took him like an hour and a half.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: It was... it was.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It's like sweet and sour, and salty butter.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: No, no, no. You can't get that taste out of your mouth. Until you eat something.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You can drink like there's no tomorrow but you still can't get that sperm between the teeth out. It's so disgusting.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: What man? What is it?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Yo, let me get in your parent's room man. Just fir a little while.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: I can't man.

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: Come on Steven hook me up. Do me this solid.  Come on man. I gotta get Darcy alone. She's gonna let me fuck her man. Please.

turns.speaker: STEVEN
turns.text: Shit. All right. But don't fuck with anything OK?

turns.speaker: TELLY
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I've talked to a few people who say you and her were... friendly?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Chess tournaments can be boring sometimes.  People have a lot of free time.  They like to gossip.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: By yourself?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: We seem to have a little problem here?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What kind of problem?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I think you're lying.  That's what kind of problem.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Casual.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Casual?  You were boning her weren't you?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It wasn't serious.  What's your problem?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You are!  I don't like you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Fine, don't ask me out on a date.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It means, if I were a killer and I thought the police were closing in on me I might invent someone to try and put them off the scent.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That's crazy!  Why would I draw attention to myself like that?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You like to play games, don't you, Peter?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He says on the photo he'll call tomorrow at eleven.  Why not come back then and listen for yourself.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh, we'll be back.  You can bet on it.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Meaning, it looks like his victims are chosen at random.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What do you mean, no?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He says it's a game.  All games have a strategy.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: All you gotta do is look at the map.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: His victims aren't random.  It only means that they appear to be random. There's a connection, we just have to find it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Morpheus.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Not what -- who.  Morpheus.  The Greek God of dreams.  Look at the next line. "Her God has gone and left his home."

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Let's see how much he wants to play.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What in the hell do you think you're doing?  Slamming down the phone in the middle of the trace.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You think you're going to catch him on a trace?  Everything he does is planned out well in advance.  The only way we're going to get him is to rattle him -- make him slip up.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: We didn't ask for your opinion, Doctor.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Maybe you should.
